job_description:
Department: Product Creation

Reports to:Director, Design

Location: North Vancouver, BC

Your opportunity at ARC’TERYX:

As Senior Design Developer, you build fully resolved product solutions in alignment with the original intent and vision of the product design, while sharing your expertise and providing guidance to Design Developers and Design Assistants. You are a passionate builder of product and bring your curiosity to develop creative solutions for a better way to innovate product. In close collaboration with cross functional teams, you manage progress from conception through to seasonal sampling.

Meet your future team:

We are builders, problem solvers and passionate outdoor enthusiasts. Fueled by curiosity, we take an immersive approach to identifying future needs then build, test, and validate products that solve for real functional challenges. We are innovative problem solvers with a focus on collaborative teamwork.

This position is based out of our North Vancouver office. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.

If you were in the Senior Design Developer role now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:

Creating and developing unique and resolved solutions through patterning and concept prototyping, ensuring alignment with Arc’teryx design philosophies, the original intent and vision for the product
Producing production level and resolved garments, along with the supporting documentation to ensure scalable construction in a production environment
Sharing your knowledge and expertise with the full team and coaching and mentoring others to develop their knowledge and expertise
Providing guidance and training to Design Developers and Design Assistants
In collaboration with Designers, Pattern Makers and Product Developers, documenting and communicating new construction processes, techniques and manufacturing solutions that meet Arc’teryx product ideals
Building partial or complete concept prototypes to allow solutions to be tested, reviewed, and validated
Collaborating with Pattern Makers and Product Developers on seasonal projects as needed
Influencing and contributing to Design in developing standards and ensure consistency across all styles within the line plan, including working with Pattern Making, Product Development and Fit & Pattern to validate and implement standards
Testing various materials to assess suitability for various construction techniques and end uses, providing recommendations on final selection as well as diligently documenting information and results throughout the process
Providing guidance to the Sample and Design teams and respond to problems as they arise
Supporting the Design leaders with special projects as needed

Are you our next Senior Design Developer?

You have 7+ years’ experience working in a technical design environment (ideally apparel)
You have a diploma or degree in Fashion Design or equivalent experience
You have previous pattern making experience, particularly CAD experience with Gerber
You are an expert level sewer, builder, and patternmaker
You are proficient in Microsoft Office and Adobe Illustrator, with the ability to pick up new computer applications quickly
You have previous experience in training, coaching, or mentoring others
You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions
You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity
You are able to balance autonomy and collaboration
You inspire breakthrough thinking and continuous improvement
You seek the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment to do what is right
Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it
A strong knowledge of Arc’teryx products and interest/involvement in activities Arc’teryx makes products for

Equal Opportunity

Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance.

Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.

All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.

Design your Purpose. Live our Values.

DISRUPTIVE EVOLUTION. Design your future through challenge, experimentation, and inspiration.

COMMIT. Set and deliver on bold objectives as we collectively raise the bar.

LIVE IT. Deepen your connection to nature and live your most purposeful life.

LEAVE IT BETTER. Create a better world, together.
